content.data: ToolUseBlock(id='call_1cd8f36ae9984ebab4c2df50', caller=None, input={'thought': "Examining character motivations and the father-son dynamic. Omni-Man (Nolan Grayson) isn't a simple villain — he's a Viltrumite conqueror who developed genuine affection for his human family but ultimately chose his imperial duty. This creates tragic complexity. Mark (Invincible) fights from a place of shock, confusion, and desperate defense of Earth. Their confrontation is emotionally devastating because it's not just hero vs villain — it's a son discovering his father never truly loved him enough to stay. The visual storytelling features some of the most brutal violence in comics, with Cory Walker and Ryan Ottkey's art making every punch feel visceral and heavy. The fight moves across locations, escalating in destruction.", 'step_number': 2, 'total_steps': 3, 'branch': 'character motivations and relationships'}, name='sequential_thinking', type='tool_use')

But the emotional twist comes later when Nolan spares Mark, revealing he couldn\'t kill his son. This ambiguity makes the fight tragic rather than purely hateful. The scene structure for a video needs to capture: the shock of betrayal, the brutal escalation, the devastating defeat, and the haunting aftermath where Nolan leaves. The tone should be devastating, visceral, and emotionally raw.'}, name='sequential_thinking', type='tool_use')

In issue number 7, Nolan lures Earth's premiere superhero team, the Guardians of the Globe, to their hideout in Utah, where he brutally murders all the ..."}, {"title": "Destruction of Chicago | Invincible Wiki | Fandom", "url": "https://amazon-invincible.fandom.com/wiki/Destruction_of_Chicago", "snippet": "Cecil salutes his fallen friend, while Debbie saddened that Nolan died, but however that explosion was to merely distract as Nolan is able to withstand an implosion. This leads to Cecil taking more counter measures, such as the Hammer, and the ReAnimen, all from which were barely able to slow him down. Things get worse when Invincible and Atom Eve arrive to assist, and when Cecil is forced to use a Kajiu to attack Omni-Man."}, {"title": "Omni-Man | Invincible Wiki | Fandom", "url": "https://amazon-invincible.fandom.com/wiki/Omni-Man", "snippet": "Only when Invincible fought back with adrenaline-enhanced strength did Nolan momentarily react, though even then, the damage was negligible.[5] He also remained unaffected by the massive destruction he caused during the battle, including using Mark\u2019s body to split an oncoming train and stomping through the subway rail, resulting in catastrophic structural damage and countless casualties.[5] After leaving Earth, Nolan drifted through the vacuum of space without being affected by solar radiation or the extreme conditions of deep space, even the force of a black hole failed to harm him."}, {"title": "'Invincible' Train Scene - Bloody Finale Reactions and Analysis", "url": "https://www.menshealth.com/entertainment/a36320648/invincible-train-scene/", "snippet": "May 3, 2021 - As if the rest of the fight and what we'd seen wasn't enough, this moment is meant to put us in Mark's shoes\u2014with Omni-Man holding him as the two uber-powerful beings barrel through an entire train, likely killing hundreds (and with their blood and guts flying all over the place), Mark is just as helpless as we are. We see what's happening, and nothing can help stop it. This isn't played for laughs or humor\u2013this is horror. ... Click here to join MH MVP and get the best in exclusive features and workout tips. The Invincible finale did take a page out of the MCU's book when it came to the confrontation between Nolan and Mark."}]}

Some of the Viltrumite's tears are left floating in space as he travels off the planet he's called home for several years."}, {"title": "Omni-Man Leaves Earth After a Battle With His Son, but Where Does He Go?", "url": "https://www.distractify.com/p/where-did-omni-man-go", "snippet": "May 1, 2021 - In Episode 8 of Invincible, Omni-Man is last seen flying off into deep space and leaving Earth in his rearview after deciding that he can't go through with killing Mark. content: The outline is confirmed. Please generate the PHASE 3 SCRIPT with full narration text, image search queries, visual descriptions, moods, and effects for every scene. Return ONLY the JSON.

```json
{
  "phase": "script",
  "status": "ready",
  "title": "First Father-Son Fight Extended Sequence (Invincible #11-13)",
  "comic_source": {
    "publisher": "Image Comics (Skybound imprint)",
    "series": "Invincible",
    "issues": "#11-13",
    "year": 2004,
    "writer": "Robert Kirkman",
    "artist": "Ryan Ottley (primary artist), Cory Walker (co-creator/character designs)"
  },
  "summary": "Following the massacre of the Guardians of the Globe, Omni-Man finally reveals his true Viltrumite heritage to his son Mark. What begins as an uncomfortable conversation explodes into the most brutal father-son battle in comic book history. Across three issues, Nolan beats Mark mercilessly through city streets, subway tunnels, and past innocent civilians — including the infamous train scene where their bodies split a train car in half. The fight is one-sided devastation, with every punch carrying the weight of imperial duty against fatherly hesitation. In the end, Nolan leaves his son broken but alive — unable to kill the only thing he truly loved on Earth. Mark is left floating in the vacuum of space, watching his father abandon everything.",
  "scenes": [
    {
      "scene_id": 1,
      "narration": "On a Chicago rooftop, the world's greatest superhero looks at his son... and tells him the truth. Earth was never meant to be saved. It was meant to be conquered.",
      "image_search_queries": [
        "Invincible #11 rooftop Omni-Man reveals Viltrumite conquest Ryan Ottley comic panel",
        "Invincible #11 Mark Nolan conversation Chicago rooftop 2004 Kirkman Ottley comic page",
        "Invincible #11 cover bloody hand Omni-Man April 2004 comic panel"
      ],
      "visual_description": "Omni-Man and Invincible stand on a city rooftop at dusk. Nolan's cape flows in the wind as he confronts Mark with a cold, unreadable expression. City skyline in background.",
      "mood": "tense",
      "effect": "slow_zoom_in"
    },
    {
      "scene_id": 2,
      "narration": "Mark refuses. And in that moment... the father becomes the enemy. The first punch lands like a meteor impact. This isn't a fight. This is an execution.",
      "image_search_queries": [
        "Invincible #11 Omni-Man first punch Mark Ryan Ottley comic panel",
        "Invincible #11 father son fight begins rooftop blood impact Ottley panel",
        "Invincible #11 Nolan hits Mark face first punch comic page 2004"
      ],
      "visual_description": "Nolan's fist connects with Mark's face in a brutal impact. Blood splatters. Mark's head whips back violently. The shock wave distorts the air around them.",
      "mood": "shocking",
      "effect": "static"
    },
    {
      "scene_id": 3,
      "narration": "They crash through Chicago. Through buildings. Through streets. Mark fights back with everything he has — desperation, rage, the confusion of a son who suddenly realizes he never knew his father at all.",
      "image_search_queries": [
        "Invincible #11 Omni-Man Invincible fight through city buildings destruction Ryan Ottley comic panel",
        "Invincible #12 Chicago destruction father son battle aerial view Ottley page",
        "Invincible #11 Mark Nolan fight skyline buildings crumbling comic panel"
      ],
      "visual_description": "Wide shot of the two figures crashing through multiple buildings in sequence. Debris explodes outward. Skyscrapers crumble. The sheer scale of destruction is visible across the city skyline.",
      "mood": "chaotic",
      "effect": "pan_left"
    },
    {
      "scene_id": 4,
      "narration": "Every punch is devastating. Mark is outmatched in every way — strength, speed, experience. His father has been fighting wars for thousands of years. Mark has been a hero for months.",
      "image_search_queries": [
        "Invincible #11 Mark beaten bloody Omni-Man dominates fight Ryan Ottley comic panel",
        "Invincible #12 father pummels son brutal violence Ottley artwork panel",
        "Invincible #11 Mark face swollen bleeding Nolan cold expression comic page"
      ],
      "visual_description": "Close-up of Mark's bloodied face as another punch lands. His eyes are swollen, nose broken, blood dripping from his mouth. Nolan's face remains cold, almost bored.",
      "mood": "brutal",
      "effect": "slow_zoom_in"
    },
    {
      "scene_id": 5,
      "narration": "They plunge into the subway. Commuters scream. There's no time to run. In the space of seconds, everything Mark swore to protect becomes collateral damage in his father's lesson.",
      "image_search_queries": [
        "Invincible #11 subway train station fight civilians Ryan Ottley comic panel",
        "Invincible #12 Mark Nolan underground battle subway passengers Ottley page",
        "Invincible #11 train station destruction innocent people comic panel"
      ],
      "visual_description": "Underground subway station as the two super-beings crash through walls. Terrified civilians in background running. Debris and dust filling the space. Emergency lights flickering.",
      "mood": "horrifying",
      "effect": "pan_down"
    },
    {
      "scene_id": 6,
      "narration": "Then comes the moment that breaks everything. A speeding train. Nolan doesn't stop. He uses Mark's body as a weapon... and splits the train in half. The passengers never had a chance.",
      "image_search_queries": [
        "Invincible #11 train split in half Omni-Man Mark body Ryan Ottley comic panel",
        "Invincible #12 subway train massacre passengers blood Ottley artwork",
        "Invincible #11 most brutal scene train sliced superhero landing on it comic page"
      ],
      "visual_description": "The two figures crashing through a subway train car, cutting it completely in half. Blood sprays across the interior. Severed train car with passengers visible inside. Extremely graphic.",
      "mood": "nightmarish",
      "effect": "static"
    },
    {
      "scene_id": 7,
      "narration": "Back above ground, the beating continues. Nolan lectures his son between punches. Viltrum doesn't leave room for sentiment. It doesn't leave room for love. There is only duty.",
      "image_search_queries": [
        "Invincible #11 Omni-Man monologue Viltrumite philosophy Ryan Ottley comic panel",
        "Invincible #12 Nolan explains empire while beating Mark Ottley dialogue panel",
        "Invincible #11 father son conversation during fight rooftop comic page"
      ],
      "visual_description": "Nolan holds Mark by the throat, mid-speech. Mark hangs limp, barely conscious. City burns in background. Nolan's expression is cold but his eyes show hints of internal conflict.",
      "mood": "heavy",
      "effect": "slow_zoom_in"
    },
    {
      "scene_id": 8,
      "narration": "Mark is broken. His body refuses to respond. Nolan hovers above him, his son's life in his hands. The Viltrumite Empire demands execution. The father hesitates.",
      "image_search_queries": [
        "Invincible #13 Mark beaten broken Nolan hovers above Ryan Ottley comic panel",
        "Invincible #13 father son final moment choice kill or spare Ottley artwork",
        "Invincible #13 rooftop climax Nolan holding defeated Mark comic page"
      ],
      "visual_description": "Mark lies broken on a rooftop, face unrecognizable from swelling and blood. Nolan hovers above him, fist raised but not striking. The moment of decision.",
      "mood": "tense",
      "effect": "slow_zoom_out"
    },
    {
      "scene_id": 9,
      "narration": "Nolan looks at his son... and sees something he can't destroy. The one thing the Viltrumite Empire never accounted for. A father who actually loves his child.",
      "image_search_queries": [
        "Invincible #13 Omni-Man tear leaves Earth Ryan Ottley comic panel",
        "Invincible #13 Nolan spares Mark emotional decision Ottley artwork",
        "Invincible #13 father abandons empire for son comic page"
      ],
      "visual_description": "Close-up of Nolan's face. A single tear floats in zero gravity. His expression shows anguish, regret, resignation. He turns away from Mark.",
      "mood": "tragic",
      "effect": "slow_zoom_in"
    },
    {
      "scene_id": 10,
      "narration": "Mark drifts in the vacuum of space, watching his father disappear into the stars. Everything he believed — his family, his heritage, his place in the universe — gone in eight-six seconds of brutality.",
      "image_search_queries": [
        "Invincible #13 Mark left in space watching Nolan leave Ryan Ottley comic panel",
        "Invincible #13 aftermath beaten son floating Earth background Ottley artwork",
        "Invincible #13 final page Nolan departs Mark alone comic panel"
      ],
      "visual_description": "Mark's broken body floats in space, Earth visible in the background. A tiny figure (Nolan) recedes into the distance of space. Stars dot the infinite black.",
      "mood": "devastating",
      "effect": "slow_zoom_out"
    }
  ],
  "total_estimated_duration_seconds": 86
}
```
